page.title: 14Heath House
page.content: Heath House is situated in Hollington Road,Tean. The present house was built by the Philips family about 145 years ago although an earlier house,now demolished,was built on the site in 1500. It is believed that the Philips family originated in Holland and on their arrival in this country set up the textile mill in Tean. The mill is still working but ceased to belong to the Philips family approximately 40 years ago.During the second world war the house was used as a Red Cross Convalescent Home.Heath House is still well maintained and is lived in by Mrs A.B.Philips,her late husband having died in 1983.The lodges,stables and various out buildings are inhabited by other families.The rooms contain many valuable antiques and paintings including one by the artist Opie.
